trans-unit.source: Retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the specified window

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the specified window

target.mrk: Retrieves a handle to the display monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the specified window

trans-unit.source: A handle to the window of interest.

seg-source.mrk: A handle to the window of interest.

target.mrk: A handle to the window of interest.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The flag that specifies the function's return value if the window does not intersect any display

seg-source.mrk: The flag that specifies the function's return value if the window does not intersect any display

target.mrk: The flag that specifies the function's return value if the window does not intersect any display

trans-unit.source: monitor. This parameter can be one of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values.

target.mrk: This parameter can be one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: Returns the handle to the monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the window,

seg-source.mrk: Returns the handle to the monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the window,

target.mrk: Returns the handle to the monitor that has the largest area of intersection with the window,

trans-unit.source: or the value depends on the $MONITOR_* constant.

seg-source.mrk: or the value depends on the $MONITOR_* constant.

target.mrk: or the value depends on the $MONITOR_* constant.

trans-unit.source: If the window is currently minimized, the function uses the rectangle of the window before it was minimized.

seg-source.mrk: If the window is currently minimized, the function uses the rectangle of the window before it was minimized.

target.mrk: If the window is currently minimized, the function uses the rectangle of the window before it was minimized.
